definition: to be fond of/to have a tendency to/to be prone to
good/well/proper/good to/easy to/very/so/(suffix indicating completion or readiness)/(of two people) close/on intimate terms/(after a personal pronoun) hello
to receive/to accept/to suffer/subjected to/to bear/to stand/pleasant/(passive marker)

sentences.english: Is it hard to see your friends live with Alzheimer's?
sentences.chinese: 见到朋友们得了老年痴呆症，您不好受吧？

sentences.english: It eats in her to stand idly by.
sentences.chinese: 站在一旁无所事事，这使她很不好受。

sentences.english: If you are sick you could say, I feel as sick as a dog.
sentences.chinese: 如果你真的不好受的话，你可以说我病得象条狗一样。

sentences.english: You know the bitter taste of living under somebody else's thumb.
sentences.chinese: 你们知道，寄人篱下的生活是不好受的。

sentences.english: A man doesn't feel right, battening on his in-laws .
sentences.chinese: 一个男人要靠姻亲过活是不好受的。

sentences.english: You feel bad when you are saving for the new car.
sentences.chinese: 当你为购买一辆新车省钱时不好受。

sentences.english: Tedious in the extreme, so not fun doing it night in night out, I guess.
sentences.chinese: 超无聊的，所以我想夜复一夜玩这个肯定很不好受。

definition: feeling better/to be more at ease
to feel unwell/to suffer pain/to be difficult to bear
not well/out of sorts/in a bad mood/without discrepancy/accurate
to feel sad/to feel unwell/(of life) to be difficult
to feel distressed about sth/heartache/cardiac pain
to have an easy time/(feel) well
